oai_dc:dc.dc:title: FLUORESCENCE STUDIES OF TRYPTOPHAN AND TRYPTOPHAN-RETINAL SCHIFF-BASE IN REVERSE MICELLAR MATRIX
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SINGH, AK
ARUNA, RV
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: purple membrane
bacteriorhodopsin
derivatives
model
decay
tryptophan-retinal schiff base
fluorescence
bacteriorhodopsin
reverse micelle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The fluorescence properties of tryptophan and tryptophan-retinal Schiff base are investigated in a reverse micellar matrix of sodium bis(2-ethylhexyl) sulphosuccinate, a membrane mimetic system. The results are discussed in terms of energy transfer interaction between retinal and tryptophan in the native protein and the conformational aspects of tryptophan residues in the protein.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF PHOTOCHEMISTRY AND PHOTOBIOLOGY A-CHEMISTRY, 89(3), 247-250
